meanings.definition: Causing a loss of reputation or respect
meanings.sent1: His discreditable behavior at the party made everyone talk about him.
meanings.sent2: The discreditable actions of the politician were exposed by the media.
meanings.sent3: It was discreditable how he spilled juice all over himself at the fancy dinner.
meanings.sent4: The discreditable stain on her reputation was hard to remove.
meanings.sent5: The discreditable lie he told spread like wildfire in the small town.

meanings.sent1: The discreditable decision to cut corners led to a disaster.
meanings.sent2: Her discreditable attitude towards her classmates made them avoid her.
meanings.sent3: It was discreditable how he tried to blame others for his mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The discreditable behavior of the team captain disappointed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The discreditable performance of the actor was heavily criticized by the audience.
